Applications of Trigonometry

  • In this chapter we have studied the following points:.
    1. The angle of elevation of an object is the angle formed by the line of sightwith the horizontal when it is above the horizontal level and if it is below thehorizontal level than it is called as angle of depression.
    2. Trigonometric ratios can be used to find out the height or length of an object or the distance between two distant objects.
